page.title: 19Johnstone Houses Sandyflats
page.content: Sandyflats is a housing scheme north of St Cuthberts school. It is very small and poor. It was built in the 1930's and the houses aren't likely to last much longer. Many renovations have taken place over the years, but none seem to have stopped the growing dampness problem. Most of the people in Sandyflats are quite poor and the scheme is plagued with unemployment.This is probably due to the lack of industry in the area. The nearest factory is a Paper Mill and Sandyflats used to rely heavily on that for jobs. Since the late 1970s the mill has had to lay off many people. Since a lot of people in Sandyflats are poor and are in fact below the poverty line it is necesary to bring better housing and industry to the area.
